description:
AmeriHome Mortgage Company is accepting applications for our Summer 2020 Internship Program!

AmeriHome is a multi-channel mortgage company headquartered in Thousand Oaks, California with offices in Irvine, California and Irving, Texas.

We offer our Interns an exciting opportunity to work on projects as full-functioning members of the team to which they are assigned. AmeriHome Mortgage Interns will work in a corporate environment under mentoring and guidance by the department manager and team. Undergraduate or Graduate students are assigned to robust work assignments to support a specific business function.

This is a full-time, paid internship over a 10-12 week period based in our Irvine, California office.

Analytics Interns

We will be placing analytics interns within our Consumer Direct channel. The intern position will contribute in the area of data/statistical modeling projects, data analytics as well as data reporting.

Job Qualifications:
Candidates must possess the following:
Must be a current student pursuing an undergraduate or advanced degree including MBA or PhD.
Degree concentration should be in quantitative finance, business analytics programs, computer science, engineering, statistics, or equivalent technically rigorous curriculum
Undergrad status: senior classification required
Experience with SQL and Excel VBA required
Experience with statistical tools such as R, Python, Matlab, or SAS is required
Exposures to programming languages such as C#, C++, Java or Python desired
Previous internships or relevant work experience in the financial industry that correlates to your degree and career aspirations
Strong written and verbal communication skills are essential. The intern will be required to participate or lead presentations to executive management
Intermediate proficiency in MS Office Suite
Must be curious and self-starter
Detail-oriented and exceptional time management skills required

NOTE!! All applicants must submit a cover letter addressing the following questions in 500 words or less. Resumes received without cover letters will not be considered

As a product of your cumulative experiences in life, who are you and what makes you unique?
Why do you want to work at AmeriHome?
What do you hope to gain from your internship experience at AmeriHome?

description:
We are seeking creative, responsible Front-End Development interns to join our team of data scientists, economists, and software engineers at Ag-Analytics (analytics.ag) to assist in developing cutting edge analytics and predictive analytics in digital agriculture and the environment. This role will assist developers with QA/QC and optimization of our website and mobile application, with a strong focus on the mobile app development in order to increase user engagement, downloads, and subscribers. This role will also work on various tasks concerning UI/UX of our website, and front-end engineering. This is a part-time, paid position located on-site in downtown Ithaca, NY.

This position will require 14-20 hours of work availability a week.

Hiring for this position is preferenced to as soon as possible - applications for Summer 2020 will not be considered at this time.

General Intern Duties and Responsibilities

Perform clerical duties: assist with scheduling, take notes, maintain files, and organize documents as needed
Assist with minor front and back end tasks.
Perform consistent QA/QC of the Ag-Analytics web application and mobile applications with the ability to clearly log findings, document issues, and relay problems
Assist developers with tasks as needed; spanning from small coding tasks to QA/QC of particular functions, documentation of projects, and more.

Intern Requirements and Qualifications

High school degree or equivalent
Studies in Computer Science, Information Technology, or like programs are preferred
Proficient computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel)
Knowledge and experience with basic programming languages, such as HTML/CSS, Javascript, Python, and C#.
Mobile Application experience a plus; applicants with such experience will be preferred.
Experience working on website development, or support for web development.
Must be 18 years of age
Must be authorized to work in the US
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Self-directed and able to work without supervision and in a team
Energetic and eager to tackle new projects and ideas

About Ag-Analytics

The Ag-Analytics® platform brings farmers, universities, industry and government together with our combined research roots, long standing business relationships, and technology development. We aim to help our users make better management decisions, increase yield, improve sustainability, and mitigate risk. Check us out at analytics.ag.

Web Development: 1 year (Preferred)

High school or equivalent (Required)

United States (Required)

description:
Company Information

Solid reputation, passionate people and endless opportunities. That’s Travelers. Our superior financial strength and consistent record of strong operating returns mean security for our customers – and opportunities for our employees. You will find Travelers to be full of energy and a workplace in which you truly can make a difference.

Target Openings

35

Job Description Summary

The intent of this position is to provide our 2020 Travelers Summer Interns and Summer Students the ability to apply to our 2021 Business Insights & Analytics LDP Intern opportunities. Applications outside of this audience will not be considered at this time. However, for additional positions posted at a later date we encourage anyone who was not a Summer Intern or Summer Student between June 2020-August 2020 to apply at that time.

The Travelers Internship Program provides qualified students an excellent opportunity to gain first-hand business experience, receive valuable on-the-job training, and take a 10 week journey to discover if one of the many opportunities in the Insurance industry – including the growing field of Business Intelligence data leveraged within our business insights & analytics community – is right for you.

As a Business Intelligence Intern, within the Business Insights & Analytics Leadership Development Program, your potential will be unlocked through robust projects, planful training, helpful development resources (Peer Advisors & Mentors) and engaging with your cohort of peers.

You'll utilize Travelers largest competitive edge – its data, in drawing meaningful business insights to enhance our business results. This community works within traditional areas of business insights & analytics in addition to emerging capabilities within artificial intelligence, big data, and social media/consumer/text analytics. Our interns work with key stakeholders in our business to identify challenges and create actionable solutions using a blend of business and technical skills. Be prepared to work with relational databases, reporting systems, discovery tools, or pilot new proofs of concept.

Your internship could be placed in one of five different areas: information delivery, data engineering, business analysis, data management or business performance analytics. This is a pipeline position with the opportunity to have your application and performance considered at the end of the summer for our three year Business Insights & Analytics Leadership Development Program.

Positions within this family work with business customers to determine how location intelligence data and analytic solutions can be leveraged to provide business insights for business strategies, capabilities, and processes

There are multiple paid intern positions within various areas of Business Intelligence in Hartford, CT or St. Paul, Minnesota.

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities

Business Analysis
Aids in eliciting, analyzing, specifying, communicating and validating Business Intelligence requirements processes.
Facilitates user groups, documentation of requirements and business process flows.
Supports the ongoing rationalization of business intelligence assets to ensure they are providing utmost value for business outcomes.
Data Management
Participates in the data governance and metadata processes by aiding in the preparation of artifacts for review and submission (i.e. researching, preparing simple submissions, and data quality metrics.)
Gains an understanding of overall data models, data relationships, mapping lineage and business rules and participates in the creation of data models (e.g. entity design and population).
Learns and adheres to all data management practices and governance.
Information Delivery
Works with delivery team to design the delivery strategy that fulfills the business requirements.
Learn how to develop automate, compile, and prepare reports, dashboards, cubes, etc.
Collection of data.
Integration of that data.
Development (prototyping and production build).
Learns how to complete root cause analysis and facilitates some quality assurance facets of projects.
Learns how to identify and inform data management of new sources and attributes for their governance.
Artificial Intelligence

Many of your projects could contain:
Text Analytics
Image Recognition
Machine Learning
Deep Learning
Speech Recognition
Virtual Assistants

Minimum Qualifications

Must be pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree.

Education, Work Experience, & Knowledge

Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher preferred.
Math, Economics, Finance, IT, Computer Science MIS/BIS, or Data related majors preferred.
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office products (Excel & Access).
SQL experience a plus.
Experience with dashboarding, scorecard, or reporting tools a plus.
Extra-curricular involvement in campus or community activities.
Related internship/work experience helpful.

Job Specific Technical Skills & Competencies

Self-motivated and demonstrated leadership experience/skill.
Strong written and oral communication skills.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Travelers is an equal opportunity employer.

Founded in 1933, Tennessee Valley Authority is a corporate agency of the United States with over 10,000 employees who provide electricity for business customers and local power distributors serving 9 million people across 7 states. By joining TVA, you will find a mission-oriented company committed to core values of safety, service, integrity, accountability and collaboration. Our mission focuses on providing economic development, environmental sustainability and power generation to the people of the Tennessee Valley.

The TVA Bold Beginnings Internship Program is designed to provide real-world experience and professional development opportunities to talented undergraduate and graduate students. As a Bold Beginnings Intern, you will impact the future of TVA by collaborating and providing input to programs and projects.

To be considered, GPA and anticipated graduation date must be stated on the resume and a copy of a current transcript must be attached to the online application.

Eligibility Factors:

Currently majoring in Engineering, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Business, Finance, or other majors from an accredited college or university
Must have completed at least 30 hours of college coursework
Maintain a GPA of 2.75 or higher
Currently enrolled as a full time student
Have reached the age of 18 years old

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Written and Oral Communication Skills
Planning and Organization Skills
Proficiency in MS Word, Excel and Outlook
Safety Skills and Awareness
Coordination and Collaboration Skills
Interpersonal Skills
Majority of positions will be located in Chattanooga, but other positions may be located in Nashville, Knoxville or at a plant location depending upon the business unit the position supports.

Students may be eligible for housing assistance if the TVA official work station is more than 50 miles from the student’s permanent home address.

An overwhelming response is expected for a limited number of openings. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted before November 15, 2020.

Equal Employment Opportunity

TVA values and embraces diversity. We encourage all individuals to apply regardless of race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, sex, abilities/disabilities, sexual orientation, religion, veteran status and age. We strive to be inclusive of all the people we serve across the Valley.

TVA is an Equal Opportunity employer and complies with all applicable laws and regulations regarding equal employment opportunities. Any applicant or employee who believes s/he has a discrimination claim (including harassment or retaliation) must contact TVA’s Equal Opportunity Compliance office within 45 calendar days of the event or action s/he believes to constitute discrimination, harassment, or retaliation.

Drug-Free Workplace
All TVA Non-Nuclear employees are covered by TVA's Federal Drug-Free Workplace Program Plan, in accordance with Executive Order 12564, Public Law 100-71 and the Mandatory Guidelines for Federal Workplace Drug Testing. Information regarding the Drug Free Workplace Program can be found at www.samhsa.gov/workplace. TVA Non-Nuclear employees in Testing Designated Positions, including those performing safety-sensitive duties are also subject to random drug testing. TVA Nuclear employees are subject to random alcohol and drug tests in accordance with 10 CFR Part 26 as mandated by the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC).

position: McSally for US Senate Remote Campaign Field Intern
description:
Campaign to Re-Elect Martha McSally to the US Senate

Remote Field Internship

The Martha McSally campaign (R-AZ) is accepting remote interns for the Fall 2020 semester to help maintain the Republican majority in the US Senate. You'll be working for the most watched US Senate race in 2020 and have the opportunity to affect the balance of the US Senate.

Many schools and programs are requiring internships to be performed remotely this semester. As a remote field intern, you will be remotely embedded in a McSally for Senate Field Office. Meeting with staff at least weekly via video conferencing, you will be assigned weekly campaign tasks and voter contact goals while also welcome to join virtual political meetings with voter groups via video conferencing. Staff will perform all paperwork and reporting that is required by your internship program.

The McSally campaign will continue to provide a productive and worthwhile internship experience while also abiding by CDC social distancing guidelines. We welcome all prospective remote interns to apply regardless of location.

Interns will receive valuable campaign and political experience typically necessary to later move in to a paid position in politics. Interns in good standing will receive a letter of recommendation from the campaign manager as well as credit pending good standing and scholastic approval.

What You’ll Do:

You’ll be able to use your experience to enact real world changes, and take part in one of the most contested and publicized U.S. Senate races in the country. You’ll take part in virtual phone banks, providing important ground level voter contacts. In addition to the base field work, your experience in marketing, politics, communication, data-basing, business, math, computer science, or virtually any other major will be directly utilized to complete special projects for the election campaign.

Examples of projects so far include: real time performance statistics for phone bank participants, recruitment development/strategy, and social media content creation. You’ll also use your education to work alongside field staff spearheading virtual volunteer recruitment campaigns.

You’ll Work With:

Like minded, driven individuals. You’ll work alongside college and high school age interns, volunteers, field staff and senior level campaign staff.

Internship Credit/Service Hours:

Your remote internship will qualify for credit at most universities. See guidelines for how to apply for credit within your specific school's department. Your internship may also cover elective or required courses in most Political Science programs.

Internship hours may also count for service hours for Greek and other organizations, email for more information on eligibility.

What You'll Get:

Interns committing to 10 - 12 hours per week will receive a letter of recommendation from the campaign manager, NRSC director or the candidate (your choice) at the end of the campaign. Interns will also qualify to receive credit pending your school's approval.

Job Type: Internship

COVID-19 considerations:
We are providing remote only internships this semester. You may intern with our campaign from anywhere in the country without having to be in contact with others.

Work Location:

Fully Remote

Internship Compensation:

College Credit

Company's website:

mcsallyforsenate.com

Company's Facebook page:

https://www.facebook.com/MarthaMcSally

Job Summary: Cole Engineering Services is seeking a highly motivated candidate to support activities for an emerging simulation and training capability for the United States Army. The candidate will support test and evaluation activities to include development of test procedures, supporting the execution of test and evaluation events, and performing hardware and software analysis and troubleshooting across complex military systems.

Essential Job Functions:
Candidates will support the design, creation and execution of hardware/software test cases, scenarios, and procedures that incorporates the use of a variety of software applications and tools.
Assists in defining integration and testing processes and procedures.
Performs unit testing, configuration item and system level tests, and supports verification/validation testing as required.
Develops test plans and test reports for all levels of testing performed.
Works closely with the leads, development staff and systems engineers to thoroughly understand the system requirements and hardware/software implementation.
Works closely with leadership to identify and define testing strategies and plan resources to ensure adequate assets are in place for all testing activities.
Analyzes test results, metrics and trends and provides feedback to development and systems engineers.

Required Education/Experience:
Currently seeking Bachelor’s or Graduate coursework in a related technical discipline such as mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, industrial engineering, computer science, information technology, systems or software engineering from an accredited college or university.
Position is year-round. Hours are flexible based on coursework and academic commitments.

Knowledge in any of the following areas would be considered a plus:

Hardware troubleshooting and fault diagnosis.
Knowledge and experience of testing methodologies and analyzing results from small-scale unit testing to large-scale system testing.
Knowledge/experience with Industry best-practice software development and collaboration tools such as JIRA and Confluence.
Experience operating in a collaborative work environment.

Other Requirements: Please note that pursuant to a government contract, this specific position requires U. S. Citizenship status with ability to obtain a SECRET security clearance.

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. The above is intended to describe the general contents of and requirements for the performance of this job.

Cole Engineering Services, Inc. has been, and is fully committed to equal employment opportunity. Equal Employment Opportunity will remain a fundamental principle, where we seek to recruit the very best candidates. CESI actively seeks to recruit and does not discriminate in employment without regard to gender, race, color, religious creed, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability and/or protected veteran status.

National Republican Senatorial Committee

Remote Field Internship
The National Republican Senatorial Committee is accepting remote interns for the Fall 2020 semester to help maintain and grow the Republican majority in the US Senate.

Many schools and programs are requiring internships to be performed remotely this semester. As a remote field intern, you will be paired with a Republican US Senate campaign in a state with a high profile and tightly contested race. Meeting with staff at least weekly via video conferencing, you will be assigned weekly campaign tasks and voter contact goals while also welcome to join virtual political meetings with voter groups via video conferencing. Staff will perform all paperwork and reporting that is required by your internship program.

The NRSC is will continue to provide a productive and worthwhile internship experience while also abiding by CDC social distancing guidelines. We welcome all prospective remote interns to apply regardless of location.

Interns will receive valuable campaign and political experience typically necessary to later move in to a paid position in politics. Interns in good standing will receive a letter of recommendation from the campaign manager as well as credit pending good standing and scholastic approval.

What You’ll Do:

You’ll be able to use your experience to enact real world changes, and take part in one of the most contested and publicized U.S. Senate races in the country. You’ll take part in virtual phone banks, providing important ground level voter contacts. In addition to the base field work, your experience in marketing, politics, communication, data-basing, business, math, computer science, or virtually any other major will be directly utilized to complete special projects for the election campaign.

Examples of projects so far include: real time performance statistics for phone bank participants, recruitment development/strategy, and social media content creation. You’ll also use your education to work alongside field staff spearheading virtual volunteer recruitment campaigns.

You’ll Work With:

Like minded, driven individuals. You’ll work alongside college and high school age interns, volunteers, field staff and senior level campaign staff.

Internship Credit/Service Hours:

Your remote internship will qualify for credit at most universities. See guidelines for how to apply for credit within your specific department. Your internship may also cover elective or required courses in most Political Science programs.

Internship hours may also count for service hours for Greek and other organizations, email for more information on eligibility.

What You'll Get:

Interns committing to 10 - 12 hours per week will receive a letter of recommendation from the campaign manager, NRSC director or the candidate (your choice) at the end of the campaign

About National Republican Senatorial Committee (NRSC)
The NRSC (National Republican Senatorial Committee) is the only national organization solely devoted to strengthening the Republican Senate Majority and electing Republicans to the United States Senate. We provide invaluable support and assistance to current and prospective Republican U.S. Senate candidates in the areas of budget planning, election law compliance, fundraising, communications tools and messaging, research and strategy.

description:
I) Job Purpose

This opportunity is for current junior/senior level students or recent graduates with an information technology degree. The position requires verification of enrollment in school and an official transcript with a major related to Information Technology. The IT intern will use computer hardware and software applications to solve employees' technical problems and provide excellent service to them. This includes monitoring and responding to incoming help desk requests, supporting company applications, helping with troubleshooting issues and assisting in maintaining hardware and software assets. The IT intern will support the IT department in providing support and/or be assigned to participate in development projects contributing to the overall productivity of the department to meet business objectives.

II) Essential Functions

A) Learn the vision/culture/practices of MHMR and the MHMR Information Technology department.

B) Exhibit a positive attitude and willingness to learn

C) The intern filling this position may have the following responsibilities:

(a) Analyze, gather, and document business and/or technical requirements

(b) Document the current process or data flows and provide recommendations/create documentation for a future process flow.

(c) Assist in the modification, enhancement, and testing of existing applications

(d) Assist in the implementation of new information systems, which may replace or augment the current application set.

(e) Assist in providing analysis, reporting, tracking, and resolution of problems relating to their assigned systems.

(f) Assist in the development of interfaces or data transfers between systems.

(g) Assist in development of data extracts or reports.

(h) Plan and work flexibly to deadlines.

(i) Support users as it relates to system needs.

(j) Assist with security related tasks.

(k) Provide training and user manuals to users of a system.

(l) Participate in the development of software applications

(m) Assist in researching options and research computer bugs and their solutions

(n) Assist in infrastructure administration activities such as server and storage capacity handling and directory services management

D) Provide regular status reports.

E) Follow IT department development methodology and change management policy.

F) Track work with designated tools

G) Performance standards are performed as applicable with MHMR’s We CARE values “We Connect People in Our Community. We Provide Access to Services. We Link People to Resources. We Empower People.”

H) Perform other job duties or responsibilities as requested or assigned.

III) Knowledge of Laws, Regulations, Policies/Procedures, Skills, and Abilities

A) Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

B) Excellent written and verbal communication skills

C) Excellent organizational skills

D) Ability to execute tasks with little direction or supervision.

E) Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers.

F) Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.

G) Ability to utilize project management and software implementation methodologies.

H) Knowledge of SDLC and/or Agile Development Methodology

I) Working knowledge of object-oriented design and programming languages (Java or C#, .Net)

J) Working knowledge of HTML, XML, and JavaScript.

K) Have basic knowledge of SQL commands, relational database concepts, design, constraints, stored procedures, functions and optimization.

L) Have good knowledge of algorithms, data structures, and best practices in software development

M) Operating systems such as Windows and/or UNIX

IV) Internal & External Customer Service

A) This position requires internal and external contact with all levels of management and field personnel. The employee will accomplish this with advanced written and verbal skills.

(a) Maintains a positive working relationship with other team members.

(b) Maintains a good attendance record

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Want to build new features and products that touch more than a billion people around the world? Want to build new features that improve existing products like Photos, Groups, NewsFeed, Search, and Messaging? Want to solve unique, large-scale, highly complex technical problems? Our development cycle is extremely fast, and we've built tools to keep it that way. It's common to write code and have it running live on the site hours later. If you work for us you will make an impact, immediately. Facebook is seeking interns/co-ops to join our engineering team. As a Software Engineer Intern, you'll drive the development of systems behind Facebook's products, create web applications that reach millions of people, build high volume servers and be a part of a team that’s working to help connect people around the globe.This internship/co-op has a minimum twelve (12) week duration.

Code high-volume software using primarily C++ and Java
Create web applications using primarily PHP
Implement web interfaces using XHTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Build report interfaces and data feeds

1 or more years of experience with perl, java, php, python, or c++

Facebook was built to help people connect and share, and over the last decade our tools have played a critical part in changing how people around the world communicate with one another. With over a billion people using the service and more than fifty offices around the globe, a career at Facebook offers countless ways to make an impact in a fast growing organization. Facebook is seeking Research Interns to join Facebook AI Research (FAIR). We are committed to advancing the field of artificial intelligence by making fundamental advances in technologies to help interact with and understand our world. We are seeking individuals passionate in areas such as deep learning, computer vision, audio and speech processing, natural language processing, machine learning, reinforcement learning, computational statistics, and applied mathematics. Our interns have an opportunity to make core algorithmic advances and apply their ideas at an unprecedented scale. Many of our interns publish at top tier conferences such as NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, and ACL. This internship has a minimum 12-week duration. We have openings in our Menlo Park, New York, Seattle, and Pittsburgh offices. Internships will be awarded on a rolling basis and candidates are encouraged to apply early. Applicants are expected to be pursuing a PhD in one of the areas listed above; outstanding Masters and Bachelor students may also be considered. To learn more about our research visit https://research.facebook.com.

Perform research to advance the science and technology of intelligent machines
Perform research that enables learning the semantics of data (images, video, text, audio, and other modalities)
Devise better data-driven models of human behavior, and/or

description:
Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst Intern

(Systems Analyst / Business Analyst / Data Analyst / Data Architect / Information Technology Analyst / Database Administrator Internship)

Firm Overview and Position Summary:

Duart Mull is an Atlanta-based investor that takes an active role in assisting its portfolio companies in their strategic growth plans. The primary focus of the Duart Mull team is working as a consultant partner to its portfolio companies in order to identify opportunities to connect management to the information that helps them make better decisions. In order to support the growth of its portfolio companies, Duart Mull is seeking to add a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst Intern to the team to design and implement systems and processes to (1) support dashboarding, operating analytics, and ad hoc analysis projects to aid strategic decisions and (2) streamline automation and back-office processes. This position is a unique opportunity to work with the private equity capital partner of an exciting variety of growth-stage companies. If you are seeking a very challenging and rewarding environment in which to grow your skills and experience in a broad range of high-growth companies, this may be a fit for you.

The skillset required for this role is heavily concentrated in relational databases, third-party RESTful APIs, and the various tools that connect to data sources in order to analyze operations/transaction data and create dashboards, reports, and visualizations for management oversight and business process optimization. The successful candidate must have a solid understanding of relational databases, proficiency in SQL, experience in the extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) of various data sources, familiarity in REST or SOAP APIs/ web services, and strong analytic skills. In addition to the required technical skillset, extraordinary verbal and written communication abilities are also required.

As a Business Intelligence Analyst Intern, the average breakdown of time is about 60% developing methods to optimize and report on portfolio company operations, 10% researching various aspects of prospective investment targets’ operations and systems, 15% executing weekly and monthly ETL tasks required for financial reporting/operational accounting functions, and 15% working in Duart Mull’s internal operations. Most activities involve connecting to each companies’ ERP/CRM systems and to third party APIs as data sources and normalizing data in order to create data models, reports, visualizations, real-time dashboards, and to facilitate data import and transfer functions between systems. The typical areas of focus include defining and optimizing customer acquisition processes, analyzing and presenting operations data, making marketing analytics actionable, development and execution of data flows between financial reporting & accounting systems, systems development, and technology selection.

The technologies/tools typically employed are SQL, Microsoft Excel, Power Query, Power BI, Microsoft Dynamics CRM, Salesforce, and Microsoft SharePoint. Prior experience in software development/ coding and database design is considered favorably in evaluation of skills. An existing expert-level knowledge of Excel is required and a willingness to learn the tactical administrative functions of SharePoint, Microsoft Dynamics CRM, prevalent general ledger systems like Quickbooks and Microsoft Dynamics GP is a requirement if those skills are not already in place.

Required Education and Experience:

Enrolled in or recently completed a 4 – Year Degree program from a top-tier campus-based university.

Preferred Undergraduate Major in management information systems, computer science, engineering, business administration, accounting, finance, mathematics, or relevant analytical discipline

2+ years of analysis or information technology experience in an academic and/or business environment.

Required Skills:

Strong Quantitative Analysis and Numeric Reasoning.
Advanced/Expert level in Microsoft Excel.
Proficiency in relational database design and Entity Relationship Diagrams (ERD).
Proficiency in Structured Query Language (SQL).
Prior experience/Familiarity with Business Intelligence (BI) tools such as Microsoft Power BI or Tableau.
Intermediate level in JSON or XML.
Intermediate level in RESTful or SOAP APIs/ web services.
Intermediate level in HTML.
Prior experience/Familiarity in software development/coding using one of the following languages: JavaScript/ Java, PHP, Python, Visual Basic, C/C++, PEARL, or ASP.net.
Natural English ability to expertly communicate verbally and in written form to a diverse and non-technical audience.
Ability to learn and apply complex technical information quickly.
Ability to work and excel on multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.
High level of independence, assertiveness, and decisiveness.

Desired Experience: (Not necessarily required.)

Microsoft Azure, MS SQL Server, and Cloud-based Data Warehousing.
Microsoft CRM and/or Salesforce.
Microsoft Power Query (M) and Microsoft Data Analysis Expressions (DAX).
Microsoft Visual Basic for Applications (VBA).
Knowledge of accounting and finance.

Beyond just education, skills, & experience:

You are honest and trustworthy.
You have an authentic passion for making businesses better and providing value to your teammates.
You are obsessed with numbers, a logical thinker, but also enjoy the opportunity to be creative.
You are a process person who plans obsessively and has the skills and background to prove it.
You are flexible and work hard and expect the same of your teammates.
You are curious, open-minded, and love the challenge of learning something new every day.

Job Summary:
Here at ON Semiconductor we take great pride in our internship program and the efforts we take to provide students with hands-on industry experience. We provide competitive pay, medical benefits, various networking event opportunities, and flexible hours based on school schedule.

This internship is with the “External Quality Service Provider” organization; working on an ON Semiconductor global project to drive and improve quality across all External ON Semiconductor service provider sites. The job will introduce the student to all aspects of business in a large corporation with focus on the external service provider quality standards: ISO 9001 (quality), IATF / VDA6.3 (automotive), MIL-PRF 38535 (USA military), AS9100 (aerospace) and ISO 17025 (laboratories).

With this position the student will have the opportunity to

Develop a clear project plan to move the “external service provider” excel spread sheet into a web-site or already established ON Semiconductor system (i.e. Oracle, Agile…etc).
System must have all required input for each type of external service provider; Calibration labs, Reliability labs, Product Analysis Labs and Design Services.
System will electronically send out and receive approvals, disapproval and/or other input as needed.
Historical records and results will be available.
Based on input, the system will calculate RISK for each service provider.
System will define (based on RISK calculations) external sites that require audit each year (highest RISK).
System will pull data to create graphs showing snap shots in time and long term RISK reduction.
Work with and learn the quality standards: AS9100D, IATF 16949, VDA6.3, ISO 9001, MIL-PRF 38535 and ISO 17025.
Assist as needed on training and update of training for global and site process owners at all ON Semiconductor sites to assist with roll out and implementation of “new quality standards” for selection, use and maintenance of external service providers. Provide recorded sessions of training using the ON Semiconductor SABA training system.
Assist – as needed - with proper solving of issues and implementation of corrective actions at external service provider sites.

Performance Objectives:
This opportunity will ask a student to have the following performance objectives:


Computer Science programming skills, including knowledge to manipulate and/or create a data-base.
Competent in Micro-soft office tools.
Good communication skills.
Business Savvy.
The following knowledge or skills would be helpful but not required:
Semiconductor manufacturing and/or design.
Program management.
Share Point software.
ISO 9001 or other quality standards.
APQP Semiconductor product/process development process.
Qualifications

In order to be considered for an internship, you must be a student currently enrolled in school pursuing an accredited degree program. This position is specifically looking for an undergraduate seeking a BS or BA in Computer Science or Engineering. Or, a Graduate seeking a Master’s Degree.

ON Semiconductor (Nasdaq: ON) is driving energy efficient innovations, empowering customers to reduce global energy use. The company is a leading supplier of semiconductor-based solutions, offering a comprehensive portfolio of energy efficient power and signal management, logic, standard and custom devices. The company’s products help engineers solve their unique design challenges in automotive, communications, computing, consumer, industrial, medical and military/aerospace applications. ON Semiconductor operates a responsive, reliable, world-class supply chain and quality program, and a network of manufacturing facilities, sales offices and design centers in key markets throughout North America, Europe and the Asia Pacific regions.

Ready to change the world?

Here at HazAdapt, we aim to revolutionize emergency communication and preparedness from the bottom up. We provide personalized, intelligent, and secure opportunities for community members to train for hazards, report emergencies, and receive and communicate information in real-time with local emergency management agencies and their communities.

Humans are facing bigger and more complex disasters than ever before, and we need your help. Are you excited by the prospect of building personalized and intelligent software solutions that help people adapt to the hazards in their lives? Are you excited to build applications that have been designed to address and cater to the unique needs of a wide variety of users? Are you enticed by the idea of working closely with a group of local students aiming to revolutionize emergency response solutions and strategies? If you answered yes to any of these questions, you might fit right in on our team of engineers and designers at HazAdapt!

We are currently focused on continuing the development of our core platforms: a mobile application for reporting and receiving real-time information about live emergencies, and a web platform for emergency management agencies and community response groups to evaluate and respond to emergencies in their areas. We are looking for developers and designers who share our drive to create a more resilient world through intelligent and inclusively designed tech solutions.

We proudly welcome people from all backgrounds who are looking to help build a world where everyone, regardless of background, ability, or resources, can prepare and respond to emergency situations in a way that uniquely suits their needs.

Collaborate with developers in a SCRUM environment on a day-to-day basis.
Assist in authoring and editing video content.

description:
Evoqua has the strength of a major global business while embracing the entrepreneurial spirit of a startup. Our innovative products have been solving the world’s water problems for more than 100 years. Today, we are building on that strong history of success – transforming water for our customers enriching the lives of consumers.

Evoqua’s unparalleled portfolio of proven brands, advanced technologies, mobile and emergency water supply solutions and services helps cities across the world provide and discharge clean water, and equips the leisure and commercial industries to maximize productivity and profitability. Every day, millions of people and thousands of companies rely on Evoqua Water Technologies to help meet their needs for clean water.

What does it mean to work here. . .

Our Mindset: We put customers first. We know we succeed only when our customers succeed. To that end, we make decisions at lowest possible levels, at fastest possible speeds – freeing employees to respond to customers quickly and effectively without sacrificing safety or quality.

Our organization: We work as “One Evoqua”. We collaborate across our global enterprise. In an increasingly competitive marketplace, no single product, group or unit succeeds on their own, no matter how remarkable they are. We are one team.

Our People: We hire for brains and heart. We are industry experts who foster great relationships with colleagues and customers. We value technical knowledge and experience, alongside business insight and people smarts. We nurture both the hard and soft skills of our talent.

Our Leadership: We lead from where we are. We take ownership. We lead from all levels. We value the opportunity to grow, as a business and as people. We hold each other accountable to make the right things happen for maximum performance.

Our promise: Grow with the Best. We grow with the best. We are on the move. As the world’s first choice for water solutions, our workplace will continue to evolve and expand, and so will the opportunities. This is a workplace that nourishes talented people. Immerse yourself . . . in Evoqua.

Apply today to join our 4000 professionals around the world as we pursue our purpose: Transforming Water. Enriching Life.

The Digital Business Data Science Intern position supports the development of data analytics, customer reports, and key performance indicators by utilizing data emanating from Evoqua’s IoT (Internet of Things) digital platform. This position directly supports operations from the Digital Command Center. The objective of this position is to help drive the DCC team’s efforts to collect, organize, and synthesize data in order to drive action and provide customer value.

Data mining disparate sources to develop analytical models of our systems and visually correlate action & events is a core competency of this job. Applicants will have strong modeling skills, experience with data science fundamentals, and should be comfortable owning and presenting their work. They should be resourceful, and self-sufficient at managing their projects from conceptual design to execution. Applicants can expect to work closely with business partners and key stakeholders to document their needs and deliver results. Direct experience with AI/Machine Learning is highly desired.

The data science team will be tasked with uncovering business opportunities and presenting the findings to leadership for action by utilizing data analysis, artificial intelligence, machine learning, and cognitive computing.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES AND TASKS

Perform deep dive analysis into Evoqua’s vast data to uncover business opportunities.
Data mining
Use analytical skills to create and test business hypothesis.
Complex query writing to solve tactical problems

Work with business partners to develop requirements, prototype possible technology solutions, and work cross-departmentally, when required, to build a solution.
Develop simplified process and tools that can be used across multiple functional areas within any business segment
Collect feedback to help product management identify and drive innovation for potential new features within our IoT platform and sensor designs

Evaluate and define digital product and business metrics.
Create visual decision tools (dashboards, reports) to spread awareness and adoption of key performance indicators (KPIs) across our organization.
Develop machine learning experiments
Advise and assist the adoption of Artificial Intelligence algorithms.

Combine disparate datasets to develop cross-functional solutions

Partner with team members to help tell the story behind the data and prioritize areas of opportunity to drive growth.
Concise and succinct communication

POSITION REQUIREMENTS

FORMAL EDUCATION:
Currently pursuing a Technical MS (Master of Information Systems, Data Analytics, Computer Science) or BS in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or another quantitative field

Preferred:
Currently pursuing a PhD or MS Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or another quantitative field.

KNOWLEDGE & EXPERIENCE:
Required:
Ability to think and execute at multiple levels from strategy and vision to execution
Interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to influence outcomes and communicate technical content to general audiences (telling a “story” with data)
Ability to write and mentor code development in Python, R, and/or SQL

We have been delivering industry-leading solutions for the payments, financial and telecommunications industries since 1990. We are the preferred supplier of networking, integrated data and voice services to many leading organizations in the global payments and financial communities, as well as a provider of extensive telecommunications network solutions to service providers.

We are a privately held company with a healthy balance sheet, secure assets and a loyal customer base that includes some of the largest global blue-chip companies in the world. Many of the world’s leading companies continue to count on us as their primary provider of a range of networking and communication services, enabling them to expand regionally, nationally and globally. We provide services to customers in over 60 countries throughout the world.

We manage some of the largest real-time community networks in the world, enabling industry participants to simply and securely interact and transact with other businesses, to access the data and applications they need, over managed and secure communications platforms. Our existing footprint supports millions of connections and provide access to critical databases. Our network securely blends private and public networking to enable customers to utilize a single connection for "one-to-many" and "many-to-many"connections over a global platform.

Since our launch we have helped our customers and communities of interest, requiring secure and reliable communications solutions, to evolve from legacy to leading-edge technologies. Today the company provides a full range of services from dedicated connections to managed IP network solutions, providing local support and global reach to medium and large enterprises and service providers.

Job Description:
Create and maintain a database to support data collected for various programs.

Generate software tools and algorithms to support the collection and analysis of data obtained via automated testing
Generate software tools and algorithms to support the development, implementation, and validation of test environments for embedded systems utilizing GPS/INS.
Research new technology to support evaluation of prototype designs
Perform system regression testing, data analysis and document test results
Support field testing events and document results

Qualifications:
Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s degree program in Computer Engineering, Math, Computer Science, Physics, Data Analysis or related field

GPA of 3.0 or greater

Preferred Skills:
Experience with database management, scripting languages, spreadsheets, and word processing software. Previous RF or GPS experience.

Coursework or experience in at least one of the following areas: database design, database management, software development, system design, or data analysis

Coursework or experience with SW development, Application Development, and programming

Familiarity with SQL, Python, C##, statistics, linear algebra, MatLab, or GPS

Excellent problem solving skills

Able to work in a team environment

Proficient with Microsoft Office products

Good communication skills (written, verbal, & presentation)

Knowledge of basic test equipment

Lab skills and experience

Summary of Role :
Perform advanced node PDK (process design kit) qualification activities and develop QA methodologies. Interface with various development teams and develop and debug test structures within internal regression testing flow. Develop and debug QA automation software. Debug errors reported by internal groups, customers and external groups for the following advanced node PDK modules: Design Rule Check (DRC). This internship position will be located at our Santa Clara, CA office.

Essential Responsibilities :
Develop and debug QA automation software
Develop test structures for DRC

Perform all activities in a safe and responsible manner and support all Environmental, Health, Safety & Security requirements and programs

Education – Graduating Senior or Junior in Electrical Engineering/Computer Science or other related discipline

Experience – None

Language Fluency – English

Good understanding of scripting language such as python or TCL.
